title: Europe’s Trade Czar Walks Line Between U.S. and China
sub_head: Valdis Dombrovskis, the EU’s top economic chief, is trying to lift the economy from Covid-19 crisis and strengthen it against foreign rivals
body:
BRUSSELS—For Europe’s top trade and economic official, the past year was largely about undoing damage. Now the agenda shifts to building anew, which promises to be more difficult.
Soon after European Union Executive Vice President Valdis Dombrovskis took his post in late 2019, the bloc’s economy got slammed by the coronavirus. When he added trade to his portfolio in October 2020, trans-Atlantic trade relations were at a postwar nadir.
